snippet: United States consumers increased their borrowing in January at the slowest pace in nearly three years.
abstract: Federal Reserve reports consumer borrowing in January rose to $10.5 billion, annual increase of 3.58 percent, smallest percentage gain since February 2013.
lead_paragraph: United States consumers increased their borrowing in January at the slowest pace in nearly three years.

headline.main: Rise in Consumer Borrowing Is the Smallest Since 2013
headline.print_headline: Rise in Consumer Borrowing Is the Smallest Since 2013
